requirement_description: The Responsible Entity shall develop a process to identify each BES Cyber System and the associated BES Cyber Assets to the BES Cyber System through either a supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) architecture, a physical security control system architecture, a deployment of protection systems, or based on a methodology that includes consideration of equipment failure, cascading events within the Interconnection and operating experience, and update this identification at least once every 24 calendar months.
evidence_type: Process documentation | System inventory | Categorization records
testing_method: Inventory review | Process walkthrough
notes: Bright-line criteria apply based on system characteristics

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall develop implement and maintain a plan that includes the applicable security controls for its identified BES Cyber Systems. The plan shall include the applicable requirement parts in CIP-003-3 through CIP-003-11. Each Responsible Entity shall develop a plan for the security control of each applicable requirement part that includes: the roles and responsibilities of any electronic access; the implementation and maintenance of controls; training and security awareness for all personnel with access to BES Cyber Systems; the requirement to track and account for the removal of transient cyber assets; and the process for handling change.
evidence_type: Security plan document | Approval records | Implementation evidence
testing_method: Plan review | Control testing | Management interview
applicability: All Responsible Entities with BES Cyber Systems
notes: Must be approved by senior manager

requirement_title: Cyber Security Plan for Low Impact
requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity that identifies one or more Low Impact BES Cyber Systems shall develop a cyber security plan for the Low Impact BES Cyber System(s). The Responsible Entity shall develop a plan for each of the following applicable requirement parts that includes: specify which of the applicable requirement parts in CIP-003-9.1 through CIP-003-9.4 are applicable to the Responsible Entity and justify any exclusions.
evidence_type: Cyber security plan | Justification documents
testing_method: Plan review | Document inspection
notes: Low impact entities may have fewer detailed requirements

requirement_description: For each individual who has access or who is responsible for access (including remote access) to a BES Cyber System each Responsible Entity shall implement a documented cyber security personnel risk assessment process that considers such information as reasonably available to the Responsible Entity through any of the following means: background checks; criminal history records; sex offender registries; financial records; and recommendations.
evidence_type: Risk assessment documentation | Background check results | Authorization records
testing_method: Personnel review | Background check verification | Risk assessment validation
notes: May include fingerprints or credit checks where applicable

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain a documented cyber security training program that includes at a minimum: the initial cyber security training for each individual who has or may have authorized cyber or authorized physical access to BES Cyber Systems and to High and Medium Impact BES Cyber Assets prior to such individual gaining authorized access; an annual cyber security training for each individual during each calendar year in which such individual has access or responsibility for access to BES Cyber Systems.
evidence_type: Training records | Certificates | Course materials | Test scores
testing_method: Training attendance verification | Content review | Competency testing
notes: Role-specific training required in addition to general awareness

requirement_description: For each BES Cyber System at a High Impact BES Cyber System or Medium Impact BES Cyber System an applicable Responsible Entity shall establish an Electronic Security Perimeter(s) for the BES Cyber System in a manner that is consistent with standards for networking and system interdependencies.
evidence_type: ESP documentation | Network diagrams | EAP identification | Firewall configs
testing_method: Network topology review | Access point verification | Configuration inspection
notes: ESP must protect BES Cyber Systems from unauthorized electronic access

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall: a) Identify all Electronic Access Points to the Electronic Security Perimeter(s); b) Implement and maintain methods to ensure that only personnel who have authorized cyber access are allowed to access the Electronic Security Perimeter(s) and to prevent intentional or unintentional misuse of the Electronic Security Perimeter(s) that could lead to a CIP incident or CIP incident.
evidence_type: Access control procedures | Firewall rules | Authentication logs | MFA configs
testing_method: Access log review | Policy verification | MFA testing
notes: MFA required for remote access to all EAPs

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain at Electronic Access Points to the Electronic Security Perimeter(s) either one or more Electronic Access Control or Monitoring Systems that monitor and detect unauthorized access or shall implement and maintain a process that at intervals of not less than 30 calendar days for High and Medium Impact BES Cyber Systems determines the occurrence of unauthorized access.
evidence_type: EACMS documentation | Monitoring logs | Detection records | Incident reports
testing_method: System testing | Log review | Alert validation
notes: Detection must trigger incident response procedures

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall develop and document a physical security plan and shall implement and maintain physical controls to protect BES Cyber Systems on Facilities by creating protected areas through the application of sufficient perimeter controls including: physical Security Perimeter(s) such as physical security zones protected by physical access control mechanisms or other physical obstacles.
evidence_type: Physical security plan | Perimeter diagrams | Access procedures | Surveillance logs
testing_method: Site inspection | Perimeter verification | Access log review
notes: Must include visitor control emergency access and surveillance

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain physical security monitoring and incident response procedures for all areas within the Physical Security Perimeter(s) that are identified in Requirement R1 Part 1.3 including: video recording of accesses to the Physical Security Perimeter; documentation and investigation of suspicious activities; coordination with law enforcement and other officials.
evidence_type: Surveillance footage | Incident logs | Investigation records | Law enforcement coordination
testing_method: Video system testing | Incident review | Coordination verification
notes: Must maintain 90-day minimum video retention

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall identify all active ports and services on each BES Cyber Asset within a BES Cyber System and justify the operational necessity of each active port and service. Each Responsible Entity shall disable all inactive ports and services.
evidence_type: Port inventory | Justification documentation | Service listings | Disabled service records
testing_method: Port scanning | Service verification | Configuration inspection
notes: All unnecessary ports/services must be disabled

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain a documented process for security patch management that documents the implementation of all applicable security patches. In any case where a patch is not installed the Responsible Entity shall document compensating measure(s) applied to mitigate risk exposure.
evidence_type: Patch inventory | Installation records | Compensating controls | Exceptions
testing_method: Patch log review | System verification | Exception documentation
notes: Critical patches typically require 30-day deployment

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain technical and operational cyber security controls to protect BES Cyber Systems against compromise. These controls shall include: policies and procedures to prevent the introduction of malware and eliminate unauthorized code; controls to prevent unauthorized modification of BES Cyber Assets; and configuration standards.
evidence_type: Configuration baselines | Hardening guides | Change procedures | Verification records
testing_method: Configuration review | Baseline comparison | Malware testing
notes: System hardening must follow industry standards like CIS

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain a plan for Cyber Security Incidents affecting High and Medium Impact BES Cyber Systems that addresses at minimum: identification documentation and notification of CIP Incidents to NERC and other authorities within 24 hours of discovery; data collection for forensic purposes; incident investigation and root cause analysis.
evidence_type: IR plan document | Contact lists | Procedures | Testing records
testing_method: Plan review | Tabletop exercises | Procedure walkthrough
notes: Must report to NERC within 24 hours of incident discovery

requirement_description: Upon discovery of a Cyber Security Incident each Responsible Entity shall determine whether the Cyber Security Incident is a CIP Incident. In making this determination the Responsible Entity shall document and classify the incident using a consistent process and criteria. If it is a CIP Incident the Responsible Entity shall provide the initial notice required by CIP-008-5 R1 to NERC and the Regional Entity.
evidence_type: Incident report | Classification documentation | NERC notification | RC notification
testing_method: Incident documentation | Notification verification | Evidence preservation
notes: Classification determines reporting timeline and audience

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall develop and document a recovery plan or plans for its BES Cyber Systems that addresses: the objectives of recovery plans including the targeted recovery time and recovery point; prioritization of systems and assets requiring recovery; recovery procedures and testing protocols; identification of alternate processing sites if applicable.
evidence_type: Recovery plan document | RTO/RPO definitions | Procedures | Test results
testing_method: Plan review | Annual testing | Alternate site verification
notes: RTO and RPO must be defined for each critical system

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement and maintain documented backup and restore procedures that address: full system backups; backup frequency based on criticality; off-site storage of backups; encryption of backup data; testing of restore procedures; and secure disposal of backup media.
evidence_type: Backup procedures | Backup schedules | Storage documentation | Test records | Disposal records
testing_method: Backup verification | Restore testing | Storage inspection
frequency: Regular backup schedule + annual restore test
notes: Backups must be encrypted and stored off-site

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall implement a documented process that identifies and assesses all change requests to BES Cyber Systems including: identification of change scope; risk assessment; change authorization and approval; testing in non-production environment; implementation documentation; and baseline update.
evidence_type: Change management procedures | Request forms | Risk assessments | Test results | Approval records
testing_method: Change process walkthrough | Document review | Implementation verification
notes: All changes must be authorized and tested before production

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall establish and maintain a baseline configuration for each BES Cyber System that documents: operating system versions; software versions and patches; security settings; and network configuration. The Responsible Entity shall monitor the actual configuration at least once every 35 calendar days.
evidence_type: Baseline documentation | Monitoring reports | Configuration records | Change logs
testing_method: Configuration comparison | Monitoring verification | Deviation investigation
notes: Unauthorized changes must be investigated and documented

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall conduct and document a vulnerability assessment of BES Cyber Systems at least once every 15 calendar months using one or more of the following methods: security scanning; network or system penetration testing; vulnerability scanning tools; or manual analysis. The Responsible Entity shall assess discovered vulnerabilities based on severity.
evidence_type: Assessment reports | Scan results | Penetration test results | Risk ratings | Remediation plans
testing_method: Vulnerability scan review | Penetration test verification | Remediation tracking
notes: Critical vulnerabilities require expedited remediation

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall: a) Identify BES Cyber System Information (BCSI); b) Classify BCSI by criticality; c) Protect BCSI at rest with encryption minimum AES-128; d) Protect BCSI in transit with encryption minimum TLS 1.2; e) Implement access controls for BCSI; f) Securely dispose of BCSI when no longer needed.
evidence_type: Information inventory | Classification records | Encryption configs | Access logs | Disposal records
testing_method: Data inventory inspection | Encryption verification | Access control testing | Disposal verification
notes: BCSI includes system designs credentials and vulnerability data

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall protect the confidentiality and integrity of real-time assessment and real-time monitoring data by implementing encryption using a minimum of TLS 1.2 or equivalent for all electronic data transmissions between Reliability Coordinators and Balancing Authorities.
evidence_type: Communication encryption configs | Protocol verification | Certificate records | Test results
testing_method: Protocol analysis | Encryption strength verification | Certificate inspection
notes: Encryption must be verified to prevent eavesdropping

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity that procures hardware software or services that are used in BES Cyber Systems shall develop implement and maintain a plan to mitigate cybersecurity risks to the BES that addresses: the processes for identifying risks associated with the supply chain; the measures to address identified risks; and the process for notifying the Responsible Entity of changes.
evidence_type: SCRM plan document | Vendor assessments | Risk registers | Notification procedures
testing_method: Plan review | Vendor assessment verification | Change notification tracking
notes: Must include assessment of vendor security controls

requirement_description: Each Responsible Entity shall assess suppliers and service providers to the extent reasonably available through documented evaluation of: security policies and procedures; personnel security controls; security change management processes; incident response capabilities; and audit rights. The Responsible Entity shall document the assessment results and implement appropriate controls.
evidence_type: Vendor assessments | Evaluation questionnaires | Risk ratings | Control documentation | Audit reports
testing_method: Assessment document review | Control implementation verification | On-site audits if applicable
notes: May use questionnaire security documentation or on-site assessment
